Method Detail

createJob

ElementaryJob createJob(JobConfigurationDTO configuration,
                        MeasurementSaver saver,
                        MeasurementCallbackProvider callbackProvider,
                        Well well,
                        int[] positionInformation)
                        throws ConfigurationException,
                               java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               JobCreationException
Creates a job for the given configuration initialized at the given well and position.

Parameters:
configuration - The configuration of the job.
saver - Definition of how data (e.g. images) produced by a job should be saved, or null, if data should not be saved.
callbackProvider - Provider for callbacks to the client, or null if not available.
well - the well of the job.
positionInformation - the position of the job.
Returns:
the created job.
Throws:
ConfigurationException
java.rmi.RemoteException
JobCreationException

Creates a job for the given configuration initialized at the given well and position. Same as createJob(configuration, null, callbackProvider, well, position).

Parameters:
configuration - The configuration of the job.
saver - Interface to a class defining how data produced by a job should be saved, or null, if data should not be saved.
callbackProvider - Provider for callbacks to the client, or null if not available.
well - the well of the job.
positionInformation - the position of the job.
Returns:
the created job.
Throws:
ConfigurationException
java.rmi.RemoteException
JobCreationException

JobCreationException

createJob

<T extends ElementaryJob> T createJob(java.lang.Class<T> jobInterface,
                                      Well well,
                                      int[] positionInformation)
                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                         JobCreationException
Creates a job which implements a given interface at the given well and position. The job is yet unitialized and has to be manually initialized using the getter and setter of the interface. To perform this action, YouScope iterates over all known job implementations and checks them if they implement the given interface. If there exists no implementation for the given job type, or the creation of the job failed, null is returned. In the latter case one might find some hints about the error in the log of YouScope.

Type Parameters:
T - Interface of the job to be created.
Parameters:
jobInterface - Interface of the job to be created.
well - the well of the job.
positionInformation - the position of the job.
Returns:
the created job, or null.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
JobCreationException
